Comparison of debugging methods

Source: vignettes/comparisons.Rmd
comparisons.Rmd

Under construction

Sneak peak:

  • An overview of methods for debugging/inspecting ggplot and their pros/cons
    • debug()/debugonce()
    • browser() + load_all()
    • layer_data()
    • trace()
  • A review and discussion of what came before {ggtrace} (the shoulders of giants)
    • Hiroaki Yutani’s blog post on {ggplot2} + browser()
    • Pedro J. Aphalo’s {gginnards}
    • Brodie Gaslam’s {ggbg} and ggplot2 internals reference document
    • Dewey Dunnington’s {ggdebug}, which also features a function of the same name ggdebug::ggtrace but which does not use trace(). Maybe things have changed in the last 2-3 years, but trace() and untrace() do work with ggproto methods, as this package shows!
